content: In the tightly controlled city of Stenograd, where daily life is silently shaped by the enigmatic Behavioral Compliance Index, everything changes when Marek Halden, the system’s architect, is found mysteriously dead and the automated order frays. Without warning, hundreds of citizens who had vanished—presumed lost to the system’s labyrinth—suddenly reappear, unified by strange behaviors and haunted by memories of secret psychological tests. The city reels in shock; forums erupt with fear and hope as residents question whether these returnees are victims or hidden threats. As debate rages about justice and the dangers of unchecked algorithms, Council members and anxious citizens face a turning point: a sweeping referendum that will determine the fate of the traumatized returnees and the future limits of Stenograd’s machine-driven rule. In the end, the city is forced to confront the very humanity its flawless governance nearly erased.
